#Text=Wikinews interviews Jim Hedges , U.S. Prohibition Party presidential candidate
#Text=Saturday , January 29 , 2011
#Text=Public domain image of Jim Hedges from the Partisan Prohibition Historical Society website

#Text=U.S. Prohibition Party presidential candidate Jim Hedges of Thompson Township , Pennsylvania took some time to answer a few questions about the Prohibition Party and his 2012 presidential campaign .
#Text=The Prohibition Party is the third oldest existing political party in the United States , having been established in 1869 .
#Text=It reached its height of popularity during the late 19th century .
#Text=The party heavily supported the Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution , which banned the sale of alcohol , and resulted in the US period known as Prohibition ( 1919 – 33 ) .
#Text=It was repealed in 1933 .
#Text=The party has declined since this period , but has continued to nominate candidates for the presidential election .
#Text=In 2003 , the party split into two factions .
#Text=Preacher Gene Amondson and perennial candidate Earl Dodge were nominated for the presidency by their respective factions .
#Text=After Dodge 's death in 2007 , the party reunified and named Amondson as its sole presidential nominee for 2008 .
#Text=During the election , Amondson was interviewed by Wikinews .
#Text=He died in 2009 , leaving an opening in the party for 2012 .

#Text=Jim Hedges is a longtime Prohibition activist , who holds the distinction of the first individual of the 21st century ( and the first since 1959 ) to be elected to a political office under the Prohibition Party banner .
#Text=In 2001 , he was elected as the Thompson Township tax assessor , and was re-elected to the post in 2005 .
#Text=He served until his term expired in 2010 .
#Text=Hedges declared his intent to run for the Prohibition Party presidential nomination on February 18 , 2010 .
#Text=This marks his first run for the presidency .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( William Saturn ) ) When and why did you decide to join the Prohibition Party ?
#Text=( ( Jim Hedges ) ) I have identified with the Prohibition Party since being in high school , in the 1950s .
#Text=Being " a member " is trickier to specify , as I ’ve sometimes registered to vote in other parties for temporary pragmatic reasons ( or have not been registered , at all ) .
#Text=I could not be active in the Party until after I retired from the military , in 1980 .
#Text=Why ?
#Text=Well , I liked , and still like , the Prohibition platform better than I do the platform of any other political group .
#Text=Partly , this is because of the anti-alcohol plank , but more generally because it seems more principled and more reasonable .
#Text=( ( WS ) ) You are the first ( and only ) member of the Prohibition Party to be elected to any office in the 21st century . How were you able to accomplish such a feat ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) I ran for an insignificant local office which no one else wanted .
#Text=Minor party people are always complaining that they ca n’t get elected – they can , if they start at the beginning instead of aiming at impossible goals .
